title: Novosibirsk
summary: Novosibirsk (/ˌnoʊvəsɪˈbɪərsk, -voʊs-/, also UK: /ˌnɒv-/;[19][20] Russian: Новосиби́рск, IPA: [nəvəsʲɪˈbʲirsk] (listen)) is the largest city and administrative centre of Novosibirsk Oblast and Siberian Federal District in Russia. It has a population of 1,612,833 as of 2018,[21] and is most populous city in Siberia, and the third-most populous city in Russia. The city is located in the southwestern Siberia, on the banks of the Ob River.[22]
